item.title: A resolution designating the week of October 12 through October 18, 2014, as "National Case Management Week" to recognize the role of case management in improving health care outcomes for patients.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4908)

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7008-7009)
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S7008-7009)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6236-6237)

summary.text:
Designates the week of October 13-October 19, 2013, as National Case Management Week.

Recognizes the value of case management in providing successful and cost-effective health care.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the week of October 13-October 19, 2013, as National Case Management Week.

Recognizes the value of case management in providing successful and cost-effective health care.

bill.title: A resolution designating the week of October 13, 2013, through October 19, 2013, as "National Case Management Week" to recognize the value of case management in improving healthcare outcomes for patients.

A resolution designating the week of October 13, 2013, through October 19, 2013, as "National Case Management Week" to recognize the value of case management in improving healthcare outcomes for patients.

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
